Content: Aura upgrades include upgrades like Fire Brand and Vacuum Aura.
Bonus buff upgrades include stronger rare ones like Rage, Seeker, and Perseverance Mastery.
If not disabled, enemies will gain a random amount of bonus skills.
Disable the main group of upgrades, including anything from Rested to Death Resist.
Disable class upgrades. These are upgrades that provide a set of abilities and skills, such as Hydroshocker.
Disable enemy duplication. Depending on duplication settings, enemies may gain duplicate copies in battle that grant special loot.
Enable level scaling. Enemies and NPCs will be leveled up to the set modifier (+1 level higher than the party etc.).
Enable hardmode. Hardmode grants enemies bonus upgrades and enables specific challenges in various sections of the game.
Disable enemies getting bonus upgrades when hardmode is enabled.
Disable immunity upgrades, including upgrades that grant full resistance or evasion.
Disables the seeded randomness of the EUO upgrade system.
Disable bonus rewards on enemies that scale to their "Challenge Point" value. Enemies with more difficult upgrades gain more challenge points, and have a higher chance to drop better loot.
Disable enemies from getting a source skill when rolling for bonus skills.
Disable summoning upgrades, such as Totemancer.
Disable polymorph upgrades, such as ones that grant wings and horns.

If enabled, voidwoken have a chance to spawn when casting source skills. This chance increases depending on the source cost, and total source points used in a level, which naturally degrades over time.
Disable restricting the highest level an enemy can be leveled up to when scaling them per the level modifier. This is not recommended, as leveling past 35 can crash the game.
The level modifier used when leveling enemies up (+2 higher than the party's level etc.).
The minimum amount of bonus upgrades to gain in hardmode. Hardmode bonus upgrades will be a random value between the min and max.
The maximum amount of bonus upgrades to gain in hardmode. Hardmode bonus upgrades will be a random value between the min and max.
The minimum amount of bonus turns to add to upgrades with a limited duration. Will be a random value between the min and max.
The maximum amount of bonus turns to add to upgrades with a limited duration. Will be a random value between the min and max.
The minimum amount of bonus skills to add to an enemy. Will be a random value between the min and max.
The maximum amount of bonus skills to add to an enemy. Will be a random value between the min and max.
The minimum amount of duplicants per enemy. Will be a random value between the min and max, as long as the total duplicants in combat are under the Max Total set (if it is set).
The maximum amount of duplicants per enemy. Will be a random value between the min and max, as long as the total duplicants in combat are under the Max Total set (if it is set).
If greater than 0, the amount of duplicants in battle will not exceed this number.
The chance required for a duplicant to spawn.
The multiplier used for elite enemies in hardmode, when calculating bonus armor/magic armor/vitality. Certain enemies throughout the game are marked as "elites", and will gain bonuses.
The percentage amount of bonus armor elites gain per rank. Elite enemies can be rank 1 to 10.
Magic Armor Boost Per Elite Rank
The percentage amount of bonus magic armor elites gain per rank. Elite enemies can be rank 1 to 10.
The percentage amount of bonus vitality elites gain per rank. Elite enemies can be rank 1 to 10.
The percentage amount of bonus damage elites gain per rank. Elite enemies can be rank 1 to 10.
